intro: Leontice apiifolia, commonly known as the sweet cicely, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its aromatic foliage and seeds are often used in culinary applications, adding a subtle anise-like flavor. Leontice apiifolia thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight.
